summary: Users find it difficult to mock SDK functions in tests. Current mocking approaches (Jest, Sinon) don't work well with the SDK's export structure, and testing workflows requires setting up a full Worker and test client, which is cumbersome for unit testing.
userImpact: Developers struggle to write simple unit tests for workflows and helper functions without setting up complex Worker infrastructure, leading to slower test iteration and lower test coverage.
rootCause: SDK doesn't provide built-in mocking utilities and the architectural design (no default exports, complex internal state management) makes standard mocking libraries ineffective.
proposedFix: Add built-in mocking support, possibly: 1) allow mocks to be passed directly to Worker.create(), 2) create first-class mocking utilities that work with standard mocking frameworks, 3) support local activities that don't produce markers for mocking child workflows.
workaround: Use a Worker with test connection and mock activities, or register helper functions as workflows and execute them via workflowClient.
keyQuote: Mocking an SDK function is difficult...we'll be working on improving this experience in the future
